title: Relatives 👨‍👩‍👧
description: Managing relationships with the extended family involves navigating a complex web of personalities, expectations, and traditions, especially in the Indian context.
sentences: Maintaining cordial relationships is important for family harmony.
It's okay to set boundaries, even with relatives.
You don't have to be best friends with every relative.
Family events and festivals are key times to connect.
Learn to handle unsolicited advice gracefully.
dos: Be polite and respectful, especially to elders.
Remember names and basic details about them to show you care.
Participate in family functions to the extent you are comfortable.
Offer help during family emergencies or important events.
donts: Don't get drawn into family gossip or politics.
Don't feel pressured to share personal information you're not comfortable with.
Avoid discussing sensitive topics like finances or politics if they lead to conflict.
Don't compare yourself or your family to your relatives.
